seed_description: Natural language query intent over one or more available SQLite databases
sampling_tips: Start by calling text2sql-list_databases to discover candidate databases.
Call text2sql-get_schema before writing SQL so table and column names are grounded in real schema.
Use focused SELECT statements and LIMIT whenever possible to reduce noise.
Prefer explicit JOIN keys and verify column semantics from schema before aggregations.
If query fails, revise SQL based on returned errors instead of repeating the same call.
synthesis_tips: Create questions that require structured querying and reasoning from SQL results.
Ensure each answer is fully supported by executed query outputs.
Use multi-step reasoning when combining schema understanding and query results.
